citation.article-title: Aquisphaera giovannonii gen. nov., sp. nov., a planctomycete isolated from a freshwater aquarium
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Aquisphaera (a.qui.sphae′ra. L. n. aqua water; L. fem. n. sphaera a ball, globe, sphere; N.L. fem. n. Aquisphaera a spherical bacterium living in freshwater).
Cells are Gram-negative, with a cell wall lacking peptidoglycan.
Reproduce by budding that resembles budding-fission.
Gliding motility and phototaxis are not observed.
Chemoheterotrophic, strictly aerobic, catalase- and cytochrome oxidase-positive.
Predominant phospholipids are phosphatidylcholine and phosphatidylglycerol.
This genus is a member of the phylum ‘Planctomycetes’, order Planctomycetales, family Planctomycetaceae.
The type species is Aquisphaera giovannonii.
